availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William James (Louisville, Kentucky, gas fitter and plumber)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, store keeper, gas fitter, and plumber. Native of Ireland. Son of William James and Margaret Irwin James. Married to Catherine James. Father of Lucinda James, Margaret James, John James, Malinda James, and Edward James. Immigrated to the United States on October 1, 1846. Store keeper in Rensselaer County, New York, in 1855. Gas fitter in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Gas fitter and plumber in partnership with John H. Woods in W. James & Company in Louisville in 1861. Gas fitter and plumber in Louisville in 1864. Gas fitter and plumber in partnership with John Ross in James & Ross in Louisville in 1865.
